result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Antoine D Morton in court. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
The Court goes over the Petition of Appointed of Counsel with the Defendant. 
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.
The Court tolls the time limits for a prelim hearing and adjourn the matter.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:54 PM Defendant Antoine D Morton in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Court quashes warrant.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states he was not evaluated by the Public Defenders office and was just brought here from Milwaukee County.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Bail/bond hearing on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

10:36 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defendant Antoine D Morton not in court. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to forfeit bail.
The Court will issue a bench warrant and forfeit bail.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

03:40 PM Defendant Antoine D Morton in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nimmer appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
